John Zarrillo incorporated the publications Guess and Nite News into this finding aid Materials in English.
New York University Archives
Washington Square College Evening News
New York University
RG.39.191
5 Linear Feet in 5 boxes and 3 reels of microfilm
1933-1967 This collection contains issues from the Washington Square College Evening Division's student newspaper dating from 1926 to 1967. It documents local and national news, campus living, student clubs, and student life at NYU as it pertained to the Evening Division students. The newspaper was published under three titles: Guess (1926), Nite News (1927-1932), and Washington Square College Evening News (1933-1967). The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collection includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. Some issues are bound.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Arrangement
Newspapers are arranged in chronological order.
Biographical / Historical
New York University has had many student newspapers with many different names since its founding. The Heights campus and the Washington Square campus had separate student newspapers until 1973 when the Heights campus was closed. The Evening Division was the designation for students who took night classes at Washington Square College. The newspaper was published under three titles: Guess (1926), Nite News (1927-1932), and Washington Square College Evening News (1933-1967).
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Researchers must consult microfilm copies when possible due to the fragility of the original newspapers.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date; New York University Evening News; RG 39.191; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains issues from the Washington Square College Evening Division's student newspaper dating from 1926 to 1967. It documents local and national news, campus living, student clubs, and student life at NYU as it pertained to the Evening Division students. The newspaper was published under three titles: Guess (1926), Nite News (1927-1932), and Washington Square College Evening News (1933-1967). The collection is extensive but not comprehensive, there may be some issues that were published but are not included in this collection. This collection includes issues in their original print format as well as microfilmed copies. Some issues are bound.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
Processing Information
John Zarrillo incorporated the publications Guess and Nite News into this finding aid in December 2019. All publications are part of a continuous run of the student newspaper for the Washington Square College Evening Division. A finding aid for the Nite News had previously been published with the call number RG 39.190.
Student activities. College student newspapers and periodicals.
